main event: On July 24, 1952, a member of the Air Force Band observed three unidentified flying objects over Lakeland, Georgia. The objects appeared as brilliant lights, changed colors rapidly, and exhibited rapid and erratic maneuvers for over an hour.
interesting points: The objects appeared as 'very brilliant' lights, more brilliant than a star, and changed colors rapidly from white to red to blue-white, with no determined shape or size.
The objects performed unusual maneuvers such as ascending, descending, hovering, darting in circles, and proceeding in upward and westerly directions at extremely high speeds.
No sound was emitted from the objects, and no trail, exhaust, or propulsion system could be observed.
The witness, a member of the Air Force Band, was well-qualified, with 11 years of service in the United States Air Force and experience as a flight engineer and gunner in B-29 type aircraft.
No aircraft were reported to be airborne in the general area during the observation of the objects, confirmed by the Moody Air Force Base weather station and AACS Detachment.
